column4: excuse me, I was sent here to ask about scripts and/or vpython
k, just ask
how would I create a script to start a vpython program?
what is vpython?
better question, how do you usually start it?
a python program that allows visual representation (3-D simulation)
actually, I'm trying to install it.
are you just trying to install the vpython module? or do you have a program that utilizes vpython?
the module? I'm trying to install it. I'll eventually use it for a program, yes
what is "it"
visual python. I'm not much more sure how to explain it
install the python-visual package to install the vpython module
okay. I did that. is there anything else, or can I just start it? (and if so, how?)
don't use "it", I have no idea what you are referring to :)
sorry 'bout that. I typed in sudo apt-get python-visual. is there anything else to do?
nope, now you have the vpython module installed.  You can run python programs that use the module or write your own python scripts that use the module
I guess the name of the module is really "visual", it's a module just like "sys" or "os", you import it and use it in your python program
have you seen http://vpython.org/webdoc/visual/index.html and http://vpython.erikthompson.com/  ?
will go now. I couldn't reallly seem to find good vpython tutorials.
I've viewed the first couple of videos ones, they are very straighforward and easy to follow.  do you already know python?
yes. just got back from pycon. :)
ah then those docs should serve you well
lucky you can look at the videos. *heh*
